Reviews.Title: “Cozy for two”
Reviews.Author: WeatherOrKnot
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with an excellent location. Beautiful & comfortable rooms with excellent beds. Very quiet nights.and well equipped bathrooms. The rooms are not large but are incredibly comfortable and spotlessly clean.We will come back !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel, Modern, Clean”
Reviews.Author: MANUEL E
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to MonoPrix, Metro, RER, Arc De Triomphe. Good restaurants close by. Room is pretty small but has modern interior design, clean, plush carpeting, modern bathroom with L'Occitane products and marble throughout, flat screen tv, free wi-fi, balcony. Had minor mishap when I was double charged for room incidentals... I paid cash and my credit card was charged too. Hotel Deputy Manager resolved my issue to my satisfaction. I received a refund after a few exchanges of emails with the deputy manager. Great hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: Joanna K
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during autumn, in a superior well decorated room. Despite the large bathroom the rest of the room wasn't really spacious. However, the stuff was very polite and the breakfast was basic. The best thing was the metro station next to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “"I hate this hotel.. I hate this hotel..."”
Reviews.Author: UncleMikeAgain
Reviews.Content: I have two young children... I haven't had a good night's sleep in two years. And my work has sent me to Paris, and booked me in the Hotel Ampere. And I can't sleep, even worse. The hotel isn't bad. The rooms are small, but modern, nicely furnished but - pay attention here - HOT. I can either sleep with the window open (it's noisy outside) or with the poor air conditioning on (it's noisy inside) or not at all. Which explains why it's now 11.50pm, I desperately want to sleep... but can't. Like most Paris hotels, this one is horribly overpriced, so suitable for Company Expenses and little else. Would I pay my own money to come here ? No. Would I bring my family here ? Hell, no. It comes with one complimentary feature: Wi-Fi in your room. That's it. If you want a glass of water, fine, that's 5.50 Euros from the mini-bar. The hotel has a bar that (according to the literature) is open from 12am until midnight during the week... but at 10.20pm, it was impossible for me to buy a pint. The place was locked up tight, and the receptionist just told me "It is closed... But you have a mini-bar, non ?" Honestly, it isn't a bad place, I couldn't ever award it one-star... but it's hellishly overpriced, the rooms are comfortable but horribly hot, and it's location is far away from everything. Except my company's office. You can find much, much better in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during a conference and I must say that I loved it. It has lovely personel and very nice food. It has a very good location as well, lot of restaurants and pubs around, also not too away from Arc de Triomphe. The music in the bathroom was great, spa lotions were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, extremely pleasant stay.Great location too !!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnNelson
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in this hotel and it didn't disappoint. It is simply a very pleasant place to stay, comfortable rooms, great bed, clean and good bathrooms! The breakfast buffet, although a bit pricey, was plentiful and of good quality. Impeccable service by knowledgeable and helpful staff (especially porters), trendy bar but sadly no restaurant. It has closed down for good in January 2012.Sadly we couldn't make use of the garden as it was a bit cold....(v cold week in Paris) A big plus is of course the underground parking. I can only recommend this lovely place which is nicely placed for tourism (Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees etc) and close enough to the peripherique for a quick access to the motorways

Reviews.Title: “Good value but dont expect any attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in September. The hotel's location is ok. You can catch the subway at a nearby stop and most sights are a little over a mile walk. The hotel was very clean. The staff however was not very attentive. I pointed out that our TV wasnt working everyday of our 5 night stay. One front desk attendee gave us complimentary champagne and said it would be fixed the next day. The rest of the front desk workers simply jotted it down and it was never attended to. We asked for an early check-in and it was not honored. The internet was down 3 of the 5 days we were there making it difficult to research where we were going and staying in touch with family back home. Overall I would give it a C.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: welshtraveller79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February. We stayed in one of their standard rooms, and by Parisian standards, it was huge! The room was stylish and clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. L'occitaine toiletries were a lovely added extra. The air-conditioning took a bit of getting used to in terms of temperature (it was -8 outside, but nonetheless we struggled to get the temperature below roasting in the room). As other travellers have mentioned, the breakfast was expensive - 18 euros each. We only had it on our last day, and the quality was excellent. If you're looking to fill up on food before a long day ahead, then it's worth the money. For the other mornings, we picked up some brioche from the Monoprix around the corner, and that suited us just fine. The hotel was a very short walk from the nearest Metro (maybe 2 minutes at the most), although we were only a 15-20 minute walk away from the Arc de Triomphe. There are a few bistros nearby - they all serve standard fayre at prices that you'd expect to pay in Paris. I'll definitely be staying here again and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: lola s
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of October 2011 and the hotel was a real surprise. I was not expecting the quality and the cleanliness of the room, it was quiet, very well designed and the staff were friendly There was no hot food available in the Hotel at the time, which I thought was odd. The location is a little far from the center/hot spots, but Paris is best discovered by foot and there are a number of Metro stations around the area. I probably wouldn't recommened to first time Paris visitors but it's a perfect get-a-way hotel and I will definitely return on many more trips to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WeHaveMusic
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Ampere for 3 nights during December 2011. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was modern, clean and inviting. Our room was a good size for a city hotel and overlooked the beer garden to the rear. We did not experience any noise from adjoining rooms, and the well lined curtains and automatic shutter kept the light out to ensure optimum sleep time. The location of the hotel is great. A 4 minute walk takes you to the Pereire metro (Line 3) and Pereire-Levallois (Line C) RER stations. The area around the hotel is quiet, but not dead. There are shops, restaurants and bars all nearby - a great place to relax after a good long walk around the city during the day. If you want a more lively area, you may wish to look at hotels in the Latin Quarter of the city. It takes approximately 20 minutes to walk to Avenue des Champs-Élysées, but if you want to save your legs, you can hop on the metro and be there after a few changes (if it's wet, the metro is a life saver). If you want to brave the rain like we did on our first night, the Hotel is happy to provide you with a decent umbrella to keep you dry. If you are after a 4* hotel with exceptional value and a good base to explore Paris, Hotel Ampere is a great choice. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Creditability”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights in September 2011. During this time I had a problem with my room. I conveyed my concern to the manager and he said to see him upon check -out and he would give me a 75 euro credit. I in fact did receive what I thought was a credit receipt. When I checked my credit card bill, I found that they had actually charged me for the 75 euro. I send a number of e-mails expressing my concern and that now they owed me two credits. One for the original I was due and one for the charge. I pro ceded to call the hotel and spoke to the manager and was told that one credit was issued, which it was, and he would process the other immediately for the other 75 euro I was do.This was on December 20 and I have yet to receive my credit. Although the hotel was okay, their credibility is questionable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: We moved here from the Hotel we had booked previously, the contrast was amazing, even though the price wasn't very different. As soon as we walked into the lobby it was very obvious that this was a high standard hotel with great customer service. We could not have been happier with the room, which was as nice as you could ever hope for. It felt like total luxury. Lovely soft carpets, sparkling clean tiles, soft snuggly robes and great attention to detail. We didn't want to leave the room! The bed was out of this world, the pillows and the duvet were amazing, and not having to check out till midday gave us more time to enjoy it than many hotels allow, and even so it was still a strain to leave. The location was great, a nice range of local bars and restaurants in a quiet area, with the metro 2 mins walk and only 20 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe. We would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Relatively central location but still quiet!”
Reviews.Author: sjordan27
Reviews.Content: Having read previous trip advisor reviews I was a bit concerned that this hotel may be a lot further out than advertised on their website - but was actually pleasantly surprised! We flew into Orly and it took about 20-30 minutes in a taxi to reach the hotel. The perriere area where the hotel is located is nice and chic and so much quieter than the opera areas etc and the champs elysees! After hours spent on foot battling through the crowds it was a bit of a blessing to come back to Perriere and the quiet hotel! We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a junior suite which was a great size considering hotel rooms are always notoriously small in Paris. Bed was huge (two twins pushed together) and quite comfy. Beyond expensive mini bar (standard) and nice views of the parisian street below. Only criticism of the room would be the tiles in the bathroom - which was basically a wet room with bath AND a huge shower (rarity) but they seemed to be slightly unstable and in desperate need of resealing/regrouting! The l'occtaine products were a lovely touch though, as were the macaroons in a hotel ampere box! Staff all seemed very friendly and gave us maps etc which we constantly used throughout our stay. We went to Disneyland for the day and used the train which took about 40 minutes on the RAR - would definitely recommend this! The hotel also offered us the chance to prebook tickets there but we had booked them before we got to Paris. The main sights are about a 20 minute - 30 minute walk away, depending on your pace - staff will give you directions and its a really pleasant walk down a pretty much straight road! TOP TIP: Don't get the hotel breakfast! Although everything is expensive in Paris..what is offered for 17 euros is definitely not worth it! You can get much better value in a patisserie in Perriere about 3 minutes walk from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Have been going here since 1994”
Reviews.Author: Madamelux
Reviews.Content: I have spent hundreds of nights here and would return again and again as I met my wife here 10 years ago. They are renovating the rooms and we stay room 36A the smallest room I have ever had there. Nice though. I find the breakfast expensive. A few years ago they used to have real barman but he left. The place needs that sort of animation again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Comfortable, Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: dkmerrifield
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Ampere Hotel in Paris. We visited at the height of a summer heat wave, and the hotel's air conditioning worked great. We were warned by friends that live in Paris that not all hotels have A/C, so we're glad we chose this one. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet, and plenty large enough for us. There were four of us total, and we were given adjoining rooms, which was nice. The windows had blackout blinds, which kept the room completely dark and quiet while sleeping. Additionally, none of the bedding included feathers (I'm allergic), which is not always the case in Europe. The only reason this hotel isn't getting five stars is that on two occasions we asked for assistance at the front desk (once for a nearby restaurant recommendation and once to call a taxi), and both times we were politely told to go on the street to find what we need. Maybe this is commonplace in France, but a bit of assistance would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tj722
Reviews.Content: I stayed here based on a recommendation from a friend that had a good experience. Very nicely appointed lobby area, with a quiet courtyard and bar/lounge. We were greeted warmly upon arrival and stayed in a very quiet room that overlooked the central courtyard. Nicely appointed room - it was very much like a "boutique" type hotel. The wireless internet was free and it actually worked. The location is a bit off of the beaten path - to get to the tourist sites involves a Metro ride (the entrance is just steps from the hotel) or a taxi. But it was welcome to come back to a quiet neighborhood after dealing with throngs of tourists. The area did have several lovely restaurants (many were closed as it was August). The breakfast was a bit expensive but it was very nice and we did have it some of the days we were there. All in all a pleasurable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LongislandLimey
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the hotel. The room was very nice and clean. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best night's sleep I've had in ages.”
Reviews.Author: salsafiend
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel quite by chance, as it was one of last.minute.com's 'top secret hotels'. It was in a wonderful location in the 17 arrondissement, which is very chic, and it was very near both a metro and RER station.( I mean, a one minute walk). The breakfast is expensive, but we didn't try it, and the award-winning restaurant was closed for August, which is to be expected. There was a Monoprix around the corner, where we bought breakfast. The staff are multilingual,although some of them speak better English than others. (I spoke French the whole time, so this is based on the conversations I heard at the desk). There is a smell of what I think is vanilla orchids throughout the hotel. It's strong in reception, where there are a lot of orchids, and seems to be very slightly piped through the air con, (which is very good and also very quiet). There is a different, musty smell on the first floor corridor, but the carpet there is scrupulously clean. (Cleaning a carpet can actually release smells: it needs to be shampooed until the smell has gone). This is the only reason I'm not giving a rating of excellent. I feel it might be unsuitable for anyone with asthma. I did hear the receptionist talking about hypoallergenic rooms, so maybe they don't pipe the flower smell into the other building. (There are two buildings, the Villiers and the Ampere). The beds are very comfortable, but the huge double is actually 2 singles shoved together with a sheet spread over them to make one huge bed. This is common practice in France, but might be annoying for honeymooners. You can ask for a 'lit matrimonial' if you want an ordinary double, but I'm not sure how many they have. The room, a 'classique', was reasonably spacious, (very big by Parisian standards) and the shower was out of this world. Adjustable massage shower head, speaker in the bathroom, and, best of all, L'occitane toiletries, which left me with super soft skin. One thing I hate is unadjustable temperatures, as I like an ice cold rinse to close my pores. (I feel cold otherwise when I go out). This was perfectly adjustable. A caveat: the glass panel needs to be aligned with the edge of the bath, and even then, there is a fair amount of leakage onto the floor, but they are very generous with towels. (If you are a tiny, French-sized person, that may not happen). The best thing of all was the electronic blackout blind, which leaves you in total darkness, thus assuring a very good night's sleep. ( I am, I should point out, the lightest sleeper ever). My one quibble, and it is a small one, is that the receptionist couldn't post my postcards for me because they weren't stamped. I found it extraordinary that a) he didn't know how much a postcard cost to post abroad and b) that he couldn't take it off my credit card afterwards. That said, French newsagents sell stamps (timbres), so I bought the stamps at the airport and posted them there. Perhaps that's the normal practice. They were happy to print out our boarding passes at reception, and they called a taxi for us, which arrived promptly. All in all, it was a lovely hotel and I slept like a log, which, as a light sleeper, is a holiday in itself.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: mkq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ampere 3 times during our trip for a total of 5 nights. It is a very good and quiet hotel, service was excellent, very clean, room size is okay, comfy beds, free Wifi!! and the area is nice and quiet. It is not as close to the Champs Elysees as they imply, but we enjoyed the 20 minute walk. A metro station is 2 minutes away, there are cafes/restaurants in the area and a convenience store 5 minutes away, all very helpful. Really recommended. It doesn't seem to suit families with children though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Fantastic Quality. Brilliant Price!”
Reviews.Author: jack17938
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great. A couple of minutes away from the Metro and RER, loads of great cafés nearby and a supermarket in the next street along. The hotel as a whole is very modern, clean and has a fantastic smell. Very relaxed, calm. The room was a good size, with a big bed, a couch, big bathroom and a good view of the garden from most rooms. It was very clean and had everything needed. Minibar, French tv (with a few channels in English), complimentary safe, complimentary wifi (although you need to go to reception to get it activated), laundry service, room service - everything needed. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were great. Only issue was broken A/C (only in our room) - this wasn't fixed during our stay but they provided us with a desk fan and offered us free drinks at the bar and free breakfast for the duration of our stay. Which is fantastic customer service! As for the bar, restaurant etc. it is very expensive - 5€ for a lemonade! Breakfast is 17€ per person per night (for us 51€ a day!) - it is very expensive but I loved it! A great selection of pastries, bread, fruit, yohgurts, eggs, bacon, sausage. A buffet style with a relaxed yet formal feel. It is rarely busy and generally quite quiet. With patio garden tables as well as indoor tables, you get a choice. The staff are all very friendly, and they didn't hesitate in helping us asking for directions, ordering a taxi for us, sorting out any issues we had. Even as you passed them in a corridor you always got a "bonjour" and a smile - which makes the difference. I think, though, one of the best things about it is that it is not touristy - it is real Paris. It is very easy to get to the tourist sights, though. The RER will take you to the Eiffel Tower, Les Hotel de Invalides, Notre Dame and the metro will get you everywhere else! The French Metro system is very efficient but take a few moments to get your bearings with it as you do need to make 3 or 4 changes if you want to go somewhere. When it comes to transport, I recommend getting a carnet - which is 10 journeys for 12€ and you can purchase anywhere. Sometimes the Metro stations are not staffed, use the self service! It is very simple and you can work your way around it with very little French. If you want to site-see then I recommend the L'Open Tour (The Yellow Buses). They have much more extensive routes than the competitors (The Red Buses).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: galit21
Reviews.Content: Located 2 minutes from Metro Station, Very easy to get to the center, and by walking distance from Arc de Triumph. Next to a nice square with nice but expensive restaurants around. There is a supermarket nearby. The rooms are very clean and spaceous. Nice breakfast is served in the hotel restaurant, which has a nice patio. Wi-Fi is free in the hotel. Also in the room (but weak signal on 5th floor). There is noise from traffic in rooms with street view. Prefere the rooms which face the patio.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk service arrogant and incompetent”
Reviews.Author: kjencinitas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful barge trip in the south of France. It was a trip celebrating my parents 65th wedding anniversary! We met in Paris and my husband and I and my brother and his wife stayed a block away from my parents who spent two nights before the barge trip at this hotel. When my brother arrived in Paris he called the hotel to find my parents and was told they were not in their room. He walked over to speak with the front desk personally since it was not likely that my parents ages 85 and 89 would be out after flying from the west coast. Again, he was told that they were not in their room. He spent the better part of the day worrying only to find out that they were, in fact, in the room. The air conditioning in the room did not work and was never fixed in spite of several requests to do so. The attitude of those at the front desk were inexcussable for any business be it McDonalds or a 4 star hotel. The last straw was the day we departed. We were being picked up by the barge crew at our respective hotels (a block away from each other). We walk over a few minutes early expecting to find my parents waiting in the lobby. When they were not there (the lobby is small) we asked the person behind the desk to call the room and we were told that they had checked out. When we asked them to call anyway they said no one was in the room and would not call. We found out a few minutes later that, not only were they in the room waiting, but when my parents called down to have their luggage brought down the phone was not answered. They brought their own luggage down. When complaining to the desk that they were not able to get through, the response was "I was on the phone"....no joke, this is completely true. The front desk personnel were the rudest, most incompetent and arrogant that any of us had experienced. We have all travelled the globe for many years and this is by far the worst. In today's economy one would think that every effort be made to show appreciation for making the choices we do. I would strongly recommend that if you are considering staying here, you take your hard earned money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris--great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayc441
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in June 2011. The front staff could not have been more helpful. Josef and the others are role models of what hotel staff should be like. The rooms were very clean and well kept. There is a (short/small) balcony outside most of the rooms, where you can observe street activity or parts of the city from the upper floors. This hotel is a 5 minute walk to the subway. The mattresses were excellent and the rooms are conducive to resting. Hi-speed internet worked well (with a password given from the front desk). We only asked for one "service" -- we asked them to get a taxi to pick us up on our last morning there. The taxi was on time and they were happy to do it. No problems checking in or checking out. Multi-lingual staff was most impressive. Will definitely stay here if I ever get back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent 4 stars hotel at a bargain price in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ccastelar
Reviews.Content: This excellent little hotel is a 4 star hotel located 10 blocks away from the Arc du Triomphe. Its a residential neighborhood, 50meters away from a nice square with cafes and restaurants. Metro station is also very near. The hotel is in excellent shape. The stansard room is spacious, very clean. Flat tv. Minibar and all the amenities of a 4 star hotel. Bathroom all in marble, seemed to be brand new. I walked by other hotels I was considering before I made my desicion to book on this one, and believe me, I dont think you arw going to get a better hotel for the price. And speaking of price: I made an online reservation and the price was 135 euros per night. Not bad for a 4 star hotel in Paris! Considering that the price at the front desk is 280 euros!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lama936
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in the Hotel Ampere, Paris. This trip was a surprise for my husband's 40th birthday. We have stayed in many hotels in capital cities around the world and this was on par with many of them. The hotel, rooms and grounds were extremely well kept and spotlessly clean. The hotel had a beautiful smell throughout. Although quite small, our room was very comfortable and furnished tastefully with a modern feel. The bathroom was also very stylish and the products a welcomed treat and the bathrobes added that little extra luxury. Although situated in a quieter area, the Metro is just a few steps away from the hotel's door which makes the whole of Paris very accessible and an ideal location. The only (very minor) point was that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which is something I would have expected. I had read this on previous reviews and took a travel kettle etc and kept the milk in the mini bar - problem resolved! The hotel's bar and restaurant seemed very quiet which was a shame because these areas were very plush and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jmarie1022
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel from May 26-28. It was an easy taxi ride from the Porte Maillot stop on the Air France shuttle, about 5 minutes. I was prepared to take the RER line there but since there was a cab stand where the bus let off I decided to go with the taxi. I checked in around 9am and our room was already available. We had a very comfortable room that included a couch and a desk. The bathroom was very luxurious with whirlpool bathtub and shower. The staff was extremely helpful, both in the restaurant and at the front desk. We ate dinner at the restaurant one night and though pricey it was delicious. Breakfast buffet was plentiful. This hotel is in a neighborhood that feels less touristy and there are several good cafes in the area and a metro stop a block away. It's walkable to the Arc de Triomphe and I was able to get to a number of other attractions very easily via metro or RER. Overall, a great stay and I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: richhistory
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel 4 stars! Very clean, quiet, the staff is extremely nice, willing to help and answer all our (unusual sometimes) questions. Beds were comfortable, pillows – soft. Clean, clean, clean. Ideal location - close to all different kind of transportation, 15 minutes walk to l’Arc De Triumph. Restaurants, bars, food stores around. We like it very much and if we have a chance to return to Paris again – we will reserve this hotel without hesitation. C’est magnifique!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat5573
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend of the marathon. A really nice hotel in a relatively quiet part of Paris but only 10/15 minutes walk from the Arc. There's a decent selection of restaurants/cafes/bars close by and the metro station is virtually on the doorstep. We'll certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and comfortable with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: oldwatertower
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is discreetly situated in a typical tree-lined avenue, nestled in-between traditional Parisian buildings and conveniently close to the Metro and cafes. Having been completely rebuilt around an airy courtyard garden, it benefits from modern technology (ultra sound-proofing and free wifi throughout), construction methods (shudder-proof despite the Metro apparently running beneath), elegant design (polished wood, light stone, simple furnishings, bold fabrics, harmonious colours) and super-comfortable mattresses. The atmosphere appeared to be lightly scented in the lift and corridors with a soothing 'coconut' aroma - nice touch! The only drawback (unfortunately typical of French hotels) was no tea/coffee-making facilities in the room, definitely worth bringing a travel kettle if you've got space.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh1979
Reviews.Content: We got a ridiculously good deal as this was a lastminute.com secret hotel so basically paid half price. We would have been happy to pay the full price! The room was the perfect size with a nice little balcony. The staff could not have been more helpful and recommended a lovely bistro on the corner of Pereire - Le Royal Pereire where we ate a few times. They also helped with finding a pharmacy and giving us the correct translation for what we were after. Although the breakfasts may seem expensive (€17 each) we probably did get our money worth as we like a big breakfast before walking everywhere all day then not eating again until dinner. The location is very good as the metro is only a stones throw away (and the RER) and the Arc de Triomphe is only a 20 min walk. Also free wi-fi was extremely helpful for pre-loading the Google maps on my iPhone before heading out for the day. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: J0_88
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Ampere hotel last weekend. It was our first trip to Paris. The staff were very helpful providing us with maps and information. They also helped in finding us a restaurant that we wanted to go to. The facilities in the hotel are good. The bedroom was very comfortable and a good size. There is L'Occitane products for use in the bathroom which we thought was a nice touch. The hotel is in a good location, could walk to the Arc de Triomphe in 15 minutes. It is close to both a Metro and RER station so use of these were very easy. We would recommend this hotel highly and would stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This is a possibility”
Reviews.Author: Kevin3638
Reviews.Content: We found it hard to work out exactly where it was best to be situated and ended up here. You can walk to the arc de triomphe in 15 minutes and there are some acceptable places to eat and drink on the way there or back. Bistro De 17 eme is 50m away and is always busy. Metro Pereier is 100m away and once you get the hang of it is easy to get around (even Versailles). Staff were helpful booking taxis and helping with phone numbers. The jardin restaurant is expensive but the standard is first class (although the atmosphere is lacking). You can get breakfast (if you don't want to pay 22 euros) in the circle 100m away near the metro and there are other restaurants for the evening around the circle. The superior room was ok for our needs but was a little small. Bed and shower were very good. The room was cleaned well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a brilliant experience.”
Reviews.Author: GoHula
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is fantastic for exploring everything that Paris has to offer. Hotel room was very comfortable. Electric black out blinds were a nice touch. Bar prices in the hotel were expensive. One problem was that there was a bad smell in the hotel lobby but im sure this has been fixed as there are no other complaints. I wil stay in this hotel again.........Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: GoraDelhi
Reviews.Content: Have been staying in the hotel since early 2000. Very well located in 17th district with metro, RER and bus available round the corner as also a taxi stand. Many dining options within walking distance. Friendly staff with stylish ambience though rooms are small, a common phenomenon in Paris. Breakfast spread has drastically reduced over the years e.g. no fruits but some cut fruits.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Paris hotel... lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: Merluzzo
Reviews.Content: Put it in contetxt, it's a hotel in the heart of Paris. The location is superb which is really all you're asking for. There are amazing restaurants nearby, Il Vino on Bd de la Tour Maubourg being particularly good. You must then disregard the studied indifference (rudeness?) of the bar staff, the size of the room, (there was a bed in there but how they got it in is a mystery). Thank your stars you didn't bring your pet cat as he wouldn't have been able to be swung. Take it for what it is. A clean, reasonably priced, amazingly located Paris hotel. Not fantastic but better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hamblin
Reviews.Content: My husband,young daughter and myself stayed for Christmas. The staff were both friendly and extremly helpful. The staff were kind and friendly to my family, we had a lovely time.Hotel was very clean and the area that it was located in was a very friendly clean area. It gave a brilliant first time impression for a young child who had never travelled abroad before.The wider community in this area were extremly helpful and friendly, Very, Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms; Bartender still obnoxious”
Reviews.Author: Pap
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel three years after our initial visit but this time we stayed a week. The room had been recently renovated. A nice addition is the electric blackout blind. Room was clean and well appointed although it would have been nice to have had a kettle. With the king bed, the room is a little small but probably average for a capital city hotel. Check in was fast, frindly and efficient. The same applied on check-out. The front desk staff and the door/bell staff were uniformly courteous and helpful. Our dog was made very welcome. I wish it was possible to say that the attitude of the bartender had improved. It's a different guy but he's every bit as obnoxious as his predecessor. The bar is hardly ever open and when it is the bartender doesn't seem to be around. Mind you he showed up pretty quick when one of our friends served himself a scotch one time when he got fed up of waiting. The guy who runs the breakfast room is almost as obnoxious, obviously subscribing to the view that paying guests are an unacceptable inconvenience. The only thing he cares about is his spiky hair! Ignore these two clowns (which isn't difficult) and this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel not to large, superb food. Need to look at door key and loo flush”
Reviews.Author: jhn8
Reviews.Content: pros We stayed with a group ,very friendly staff just right size not like Hilton etc .Food in Restaurant was superb.Well located for Metro and can walk to Arc de Triomphe. Rooms well decorated.separate loo and bathroom . Cons. Mini bar very expensive,door key difficult to use and loos took lot of strength to flush.They did not seem able to fix these problems and I see others had same difficulties. Room funny shape but adequate

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel, at most a 3 star. Rooms very dated and some staff very rude.”
Reviews.Author: hawking81
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel for a romantic break and were disappointed immediately on entering the room. At first we couldn't open the room door with the key card for about 5 minutes. It clearly wasn't 4 star and the toilet didn't flush. We called someone up from reception and he came up stinking of cigarettes and was very rude and arrogant. He spoke to us like we were stupid and said we weren't pushing the flush hard enough. It finally worked but I had to get my boyfriend to flush the toilet for me for the whole 3 days as their had to be a ceratin 'knack' and super human strength to do it. Whenever we went to bed we could hear the pipes in the room next door every time someone ran the tap or took a shower. So I was woken every morning at around 7am with the noise of the neighbours showering. The only good things I can say about this hotel is the location is very convienient to get to the sights/metro etc and it was quite clean. One man on reception in the evening was helpful with directions. The recpection area is impressive when you arrive but their is little to shout about. A tiny bottle of water from the fridge cost 5 euros, so bring your own!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and great reception staff”
Reviews.Author: helendorothy11131
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone in Europe for the first time and I found the Ampere reception staff had an excellent command of English and were most helpful. My room was of a high standard for the rating of the hotel and scrupulously clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer ervice and quiet safe location”
Reviews.Author: amethystam
Reviews.Content: Ampere Hotel is more 3 star than 4 star. Not exactly located in central Paris, however Metro station is just across the road. Location is at a nice quiet residential area. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are smaller than expected, but clean and bright. Bed is very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and comfortable stay..”
Reviews.Author: Yi0rg0s
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for first time travellers as well as for people who would like to see all major monuments in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with nice ambience, close to good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: pushpim
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, clean rooms, separate toilet to shower which was nice and private. Dim lit romantic bar, expensive but good ambience. Location quiet but also 2 mins walk to roundabout with resturants all around, ranging from expensive to reasonable for Paris! Metro 2 mins walk. It is out of the city so you have to travel a bit on the metro however it poured the whole trip for us to maybe walking would have been nicer and quicker if we could have. All in all lovely stay at this hotel, cant fault it, private, warm, quiet and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great night sleep and good customer service in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pahayden
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to the Hotel Ampere. My girlfriend and I came for a 3-night stay in Paris. The front desk staff was very helpful and welcoming. On arrival they gave us a map and pointed out some interesting areas to go. Upon leaving, they booked us a cab in advance, and helped us with our luggage to the car. Very helpful and respectful staff. The hotel is beautiful, and overall a good value. Hotels in Paris are expensive, but for the price this hotel is a good bet. Public spaces are gorgeous, the hotel smells nice, and the breakfast was pretty good (although a little pricey). Although quite small, our room was decorated very well, and the bed was so comfortable. Our three nights in Paris provided the best sleep we got out of our three-city trip to Europe. Amazing! Even while sleeping in quite late the first day, we were never interrupted by noise from cleaning staff or other guests. You have to pay for Wi-Fi, but wired internet access is complimentary and quite fast. The neighborhood is really nice. A little bit out of the center of the city, but very close to the Metro, which is very efficient and affordable. There are several restaurants and brasseries just a block away near the Pereire Metro stop. Overall, this is a great hotel. A little small, and a little pricey, but I think that's just Paris. I would return gladly.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Iain____Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Ampere each year for the last 5 years on what has become my annual pilgrimage to Paris. The Ampere had been my 1st choice due to the rooms on offer & the value for money received. On this visit I have to say my love affair has come to an end. The hotel went under new management last year I think and just does not provide the same value for money and the rooms are starting to look Jaded. One of the previous benefits of booking the Ampere was the buffet style breakfast that had been included in the price. This was not only a nice touch but also a convenient way to start the day before going out to explore wonderful Paris. This time round the hotel was expecting us to pay 18 euros each for this and although nice it is certainly not worth this. The rooms are now in need of renovation and starting to look very outdated with their early 1990's heavy bed covers. I have stayed in the Ampere happily for many years but just began to feel that this year the hotel management are starting to take their customers for granted. The room air conditioning was bearly noticeable and the carpets looked stained and tired, the wooden desktops in need of varnishing. Put simply the rooms are not horrendous but they are certainly not in keeping with a modern 4 star hotel. Don't open the minbar unless you want to pay 6 euros for a coke (Yes Hotel Minibars are expensive but this is just excessive) and dont expect to pay less than 9 euros for the smallest glass of wine I have seen in a long time. As much as it saddens me to say I do not think I could recommend the Ampere now to anyone who is looking for a 4 star hotel as the facilities on offer are no better than a 3 star but at 4 star prices and if you are going to pay for 4 star you do expect just a bit better. Paris itself however gets 5 stars all the way :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific rooms, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: triciahek
Reviews.Content: My husband,three children- 12, 10, 7 and I stayed at the Ampere Hotel for 6 nights at the end of July into the beginning of August. The hotel was on a quiet, easy to find street, close to metro stations. It is a short walk 15 min or so walk to the famed Arch de Triumphe and the Champs Elysse. There are some nice restaurants, cafe's and bakeries nearby. We even found a terrific market to pick up essentials- just two blocks away. The rooms were very clean and comfortable- the beds and pillows were heavenly! The free standing shower was a little tight- and I am only 5'4" tall and I thought it was tight, but other than that, the rooms were typical size for a European hotel. The addition of L'Occitaine soaps and shower products is a nice luxury! We had two rooms not adjoining but next to each other- we were all very comfortable. Although we did not eat at the Hotel restaurant, the menu featured some great entrees. It was very hot when we visited and the rooms were very comfortably air conditioned. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experiance”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVickx
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at this property and the first time with the family, had a truly memorable experiance and the staff went out of the way to assist

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: hetalgir
Reviews.Content: - Clean rooms, but poor bed quality - 2 single beds do not make a double bed! - No complimentary add-ons for honeymoon couples. A double bed as originally requested would have been nice. - Rooms were very small, but perhaps this is normal for a city. - Breakfast should be included in the price, upto Euro20 per head is a rip off. - Staff were generally friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: thedeeleys
Reviews.Content: we stopped at the ampere in paris for 2 days. the hotel was in a good location and good area about a mile walk from the arc de triomphe. it has its own secure carpark . the staff were very helpful and spoke english. the rooms are a average size. the rooms were very clean and serviced daily. breakfast was good but not great, could do with a gym ect. everthing worked so would reccomend for a few days in paris. taxi price to louvre was 12 euros sacre cour was 10 euros so not bad at all. bar price 6 euros for a coke ouch but it is paris so it was never going to be cheap. we would return to the ampere.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here for the final night of a 10...”
Reviews.Author: suddenlyjoey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the final night of a 10 day trip to Europe and this hotel was a very comfortable way to end my trip. The staff at the desk were kind and accomodating. We stayed on a high floor with a great view of the rooftops of Paris and the tip of the Eiffel Tower. The room wasn't nearly as small as I expected and there was plenty of space to put or stuff. The bathroom was very clean and stocked with everything we needed, including bathrobes and slippers. The toilet was even in a separate space to itself away from the sink and shower. The location was very convienent should you want to walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro was just right around the corner. Of course, it's a bit pricey, but I still recommend it if you are looking for a comfy central-Paris hotel and can find a good rate on a site like Expedia. Oh, and FYI: When you enter your room there is a slot just inside the door for your room keycard. You can't turn the lights on until you put your card in the slot. This tripped us up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern, clean and conveniently located. The staff was very helpful with public transit suggestions and gave us a free upgrade on check-in.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: half62
Reviews.Content: Not an impressive entrence side, but lovely inside. Nice garden for breakfast, good beds, totally quite.

Reviews.Title: “Well run, good 4 star hotel with comfortable rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: travellingchef
Reviews.Content: Very good 4 star hotel in quiet location, but close to centre of Paris and close to Metro and good reaturants. Helpful, friendly staff, comfortable rooms (not large but well laid out and comfortable with nice bathrooms, free broadband internet and room safe. Would happily recommend and stay again. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful atmosphere,quiet,calm,new refurb,pleasant and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: littleal13
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel added to our wonderful week long stay in Paris. From the outside it is very smart in a quiet neighbourhood(several bistros and bars a few steps away). I breathed a sigh of relief as soon as I stepped inside, it is newly refurbished to a high standard, modern but comfortable. Staff very welcoming and helpful, free internet in foyer, great for email and general info. Bedroom was very nicely done out and felt brand new. Toilet and bathroom are separate which is more convenient and gives you 3 separate spaces. The metro is literally across the road and the hotel is a 15min walk from Arc de Triomphe. I was with my 5 year old daughter and we enjoyed the free and easy atmosphere, it's like a sanctuary after a hard days sight seeing! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Hotel Ampere and thought for £100 a night in Paris in high season it was excellent VFM.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Quanie
Reviews.Content: I agreed with the last review that the hotel was more of a three stars than four stars. I believed the hotel is too overpriced for the facilities and room but it is in a good location with the Metro under 5 minutes walk away. The staff are friendly and helpful with our requests. If you decided to stay there, I advise that you bring your own shampoo. They uses this product called Hydro and it left my hair feeling like clumps and too squeaky straight after I washed it. There is a small cafe nearby that does sandwiches, pizzas and crepes... highly recommended as the man there is very nice and we tried our first pizza with an egg in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “A quick stay in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisad1983
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Ampere Hotel in Paris for two nights at the start of our honeymoon. We found check in to be very efficient, the staff spoke good English. Service was good, taxi's were booked for us and luggage taken to room etc. The decor and general quality of the room was the best of all the hotels we stayed in during our two week honeymoon in France. There were robes on the back of the bathroom doors and free slippers, as well as a reasonably priced minibar (considering!) sat TV, a Seperate shower and bath!! If you dont mind a bit of a walk, We turned right out of the hotel (i think!) then right again and walked for about 20 minutes down the road lined with shops and restuarants, which brings you out at the Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elyess. We didn't eat in the restaurant as it was very over priced from what we saw on the menu, but this isn't a problem as you're in a city where there are loads of restaurants everywhere, but choose wisely, especially if you are English, because they know you're a tourist and like to try and rip you off a bit!! We had breakfast on both mornings, and both mornigs was delivered to our rooms on time. It was a continental breakfast consisting of breads and pastries, yoghurt, orange juice, tea, coffee or hot chocolate, and was yummy but again, a little over priced for what it was!! Overall a lovely hotel, and i would have no reservations in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the price”
Reviews.Author: pf000sk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful place to stay a few years ago. I stayed regularly for 3 years but this year was the last time... The staff once offered a sparkling white wine upon your arrival at the hotel and there used to be a piano player on occasion. The barman, now gone to another establishment due to budget cuts, was the mainstay of this hotel's hospitality. The rooms are clean, if small for Americans, (everything in these old cities is small if you stay near the centers, FYI) and tidy. Depending on the price, I would stay here again... but it would have to be a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & good value”
Reviews.Author: awaywithya
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a good size for Paris. Fluffy bathrobes & slippers were greatly appreciated after a busy day taking in the sights. Staff friendly & helpful. Very quiet with no noise heard from within or without. Lovely area & the metro is only 1 minutes' walk away! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “good location but small room”
Reviews.Author: changezWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary. Make sure you use the Piere metro station and not villiers as that was a long street and a long walk from the hotel. Hotel was good. Breakfast was fantastic with brilliant variety. However, restuarant service very poor. Waited for a plate for20min and when it arrived it was dirty! Overall, would still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A 2-3 * at best!”
Reviews.Author: Peaches_091
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed over the weekend. Hotel looks nice on the outside, staff friendly and the reception area looks inviting and comfortable. Problems started once we had entered our room. First the maid walked in as we were unpacking which you can excuse but didn't exactly put us at ease as to who was walking in and out of our room. Opened the mini bar and the fridge was switched off so even if we wanted to take something, we wouldn't be tempted. Tried the air conditioning as it was humid at night and that didn't work making evenings uncomfortable. The lift broke down for 1.5 days and most people are situated on the 5th floor upwards and was really the last straw. The hotel is also a little outside of central making it inconvenient if you wanted to go further than The Louvre or Opera area of Paris. Overall, wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with good central location ideal for a romantic weekend away”
Reviews.Author: BonneVoyager
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - rooms luxuriously appointed, but quite small as I imagine they tend to be in Paris. Loved the complimentary breakfasts in bed up to 11am (no extra charge), free wi-fi robes, slippers, balcony and flatscreen tv, glamerous bathroom. Most staff were very helpful despite my awful French and some spoke fluent English. One complaint - could not put do not disturb on door as breakfast had been ordered, but disturbed by non english speaking house keeping staff who persistantly knocked but counld not explain the reason - presume to make up the room, but 8.30 on a sunday morning seems extreme! Also very slow check-in which could have been more welcoming and check out was chilly but I think that was just due to the typical French reserve that we are not really used to. Location good - 15 mins walk from Arc de Triumph, great japenese and lebonese restaurants across the street. The piano bar which was made so much of in the website wasn't open while we were there but the garden was lovely for cocktails/breakfast. There was a restaurant which looked nice but we had sushi across the road instead. Great Value would definitely consider staying there again, but might enquire if they had any slightly larger rooms. All in all great deal and very pleased to recommend overall

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Heljie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ampere hotel for 2 nights bed and breakfast. The hotel decor' was modern and clean and our initial impression was very good. We stayed in a standard room which was in good condition. The location was great and in a nice area of Paris and close to the Metro. Our only criticism of the hotel was the breakfast. The food was of a good standard but the restaurant was dis-organised and the lack of staff serving in the restaurant meant that food trays were not replenished and we had to wait for cutlery and cups on both days. We booked via a booking agent on the internet but it was cheaper booking directly with the hotel. Overall a good hotel and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault as a base to explore Paris from”
Reviews.Author: rlw_chester
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in June (myself, partner and two teeenage sons), and found the Ampere to be all we needed as a clean, comfortable, friendly base from which to see Paris. The staff were all helpful (tolerant of our poor French and willing to switch to English when we got stuck), the rooms were a decent size, modern and spotless, and the public areas were bright and welcoming. One slight quibble - it was difficult to get someone to serve us in the bar, but there are plenty of cafes just outside the door. The Metro & RER are 2 mins walk away, and you can stroll to the Camps Elysees in 15 mins. Try the Bistro 17e two doors down; it's great value and excellent quality, but we suggest you pop by and book as it gets v. busy.

Reviews.Title: “Some good - some bad”
Reviews.Author: HelpfulHarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in mid June 2009. Not a four star by any standards other than Paris, but good bright reception area, clean room which was well serviced each day, and a decent location in safe clean area, close to a metro. Friendly and very helpful reception staff. Breakfast wasn't included for us, and at €17 per head added €34 to the room cost. It definitley wasn't worth it. You'll get a much better coffee elsewhere. No tea/coffee making facilities was a surprise for a "4 star" , and the room we had certainly wasn't large, but don't expect much space in Paris. The bed was comfortable and the room was very quiet and peaceful, with none of the traditional street noise you sometimes get. The garden is small, so don't get your hopes up. We had a bizarre experience, we wanted to order two glasses of wine and sit out in the sun, but we sat out at a bench that apparently belonged to the restauratnt, and not the hotel?? It was the only seat in the sunshine, but two staff members insisted that we move to another seat which was about 15 feet away but in the shade, apparently it was the outdoor seat seat for the bar. This was mid-afternoon, the restuarant was closed at the time and we were the only people in the garden. Don't order a taxi from reception, just walk 200 meters to the metro and there's a taxi rank there, the taxis seem to charge from wherever they are when they're called, one guy had €12.50 on the meter before we even got in, and another guy had €6.50 on it. Overall summary: Good, but not fantastic. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Third hotel lucky in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: baglady83
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for the third time in May 09 and stayed at the 4* Hotel Ampere. Absolutely no complaints about this gorgeous hotel in a very affluent area. We often ventured to the more modest areas such as le marais and st michael for cheaper meals but would certainly recommend this hotel. The best we've stayed at of all of the three times in Paris, a city which never fails to romance me.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: dyonysios
Reviews.Content: Despite the 4 stars that you'll find printed, emblazoned or embroidered on anything you can see or touch, this hotel is NOT. Facilities: We booked well in advance and provided our contact details yet the hotel failed to inform us before arriving that they had the plumbers in and there was no water from noon to evening the whole time we were there . They didn't think to perhaps offer a couple of bottles of water in the room that might have been used for washing hands and faces or even to drink. They'd also torn out the bar near the lobby for renovations but hadn't set up any alternative facilities. I'll never get used to the fact that most European hotels seemed to have dispensed with any sort of welcome for their guests. Many don't even have doormen or bell staff and you're expected to fend for yourself hauling bags out of the taxi and up to your room etc. This place was no exception. Reception and Room Check in was fairly painless (for us, another pair of guests seemed to be quite worked up about something) and we went up to our room which was non-smoking with a garden view as requested. Don't bother though, its not worth the premium. Room size was about 18 - 20 sq meters which is quite nice for Paris. The bathroom however was tiny, and due to the water problem, the toilet would not flush for half the day. The paint on the walls was peeling in places and the bedspread and carpet had definitely seen better days. There were traces of mold at the edges of the window and in the bathroom. The desk and other furniture were of cheap materials and were chipped and scuffed. They also use those cheap refillable bottles for their generic toiletries so remember to bring your own. There were no dressing gowns or slippers and when we asked at reception they snootily informed us these were not provided in our room category. However they did deign to send some up about an hour later so my hunch is they just don't have enough to go around or are saving on laundry bills. Incidentally, the reception closes at night (there is an on duty clerk who hides in his office) and you have to swipe your keycard at the door to let yourself in to a darkened lobby after 11. Breakfast: Our price included it so we dutifully went down to find a selection and presentation that was modest and bland. They clearly don't think its a meal their guests should enjoy as much as just fuel-up on before pushing off for the day. The restaurant was clean and well lit though. The highlight of the stay however was when we came back from wandering in the city to find a pack of half-eaten mixed nuts and a bottle of half-empty mineral water on the table. It seems someone from house keeping had decided to have their break in our room and helped themselves to the mini-bar? My girlfriend was quite put-off by this and I must say I didn't hide my feelings either when speaking to the manager. He promised in true Clouseau fashion to "launch an investigation" and offered us a complimentary bottle of wine - a mini bottle and not a full one! Language: They do speak English but retreat into pretending not to understand when you have any questions or complaints. Luckily we're both fluent in French so when they threw up their shoulders in the famous gallic shrug and pretended not to understand, we switched to that language just to be helpful. It may have caused some dismay behind the counter. Summary: If we hadn't booked, paid for and expected a 4 star we would have been less disappointed. The hotel clearly over-sells itself and then fails to deliver. Or perhaps we just have high standards being used to the amazing hospitality you get all over Asia and the Far East. To be fair a couple of the reception staff were quite friendly, the rooms weren't smelly and all the switches and things worked. But the incident of finding someone had picnicked in our room (and god knows what else) really put us off. Paris is expensive, customer service is primitive and the French have a world famous attitude problem but even here you can definitely find better at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: OliverBristol
Reviews.Content: Clean, roomy (for Paris) hotel room with a really comfortable bed. We booked a last minute bargain and we were still given the room with a balcony and a view of the courtyard. Really close to the metro in a very 'safe and clean' area of Paris. Slightly further away from the centre but not a problem if you like to walk. The metro was very easy to use, punctual and frequent. My only real whine is about the lack of a kettle or coffee facilities in this room of this 4 star hotel. That would have been fine if two coffees collected from the bar hadn't cost 17 euros!!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dpeverall
Reviews.Content: my partner and I stayed at the ampere hotel for 4 days 22-25 may. we were both very impressed with the hotel - good size room, very clean and comfortable and the hotel overall was peaceful so you can get a good night's sleep. the hotel has a restaurant overlooking the garden, which looked charming although we didn't make use of it. the staff are so polite and helpful, they could speak english and were always happy to help. location is perfect, a stone's throw away from a metro station and an RER station so very well connected to all the attractions - we used the metro to travel all around paris and see all the sights as it's fast and much cheaper than the hop on / hop off buses. it is also within walking distance of the arc de triomphe and champs elysees area - we walked there every day and i'd say it takes 15 minutes to get there. the area the hotel is in, on avenue de villiers, is a nice suburb of paris and has many bistros/cafes etc right next to the hotel if you fancy staying locally. all in all, we loved staying at this hotel and would highly recommend it - very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “My First Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: commentators
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and my husband's fourth! We stayed the initial four days of our trip at the Hotel Ampere...beautiful from the outside as well as when you walk into the lobby....the daily care of the room was absolutely fantastic....although the concierge at the front desk was only moderately helpful....and word to the wise, if they say breakfast is till 10, be there at 9. otherwise you may end up with no silverware napkins, or service of any kind. Overall I'd say our stay at the Ampere was a good one. I'd recommend it....along with a handy watch and a thick skin!

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou Hotek Ampere”
Reviews.Author: StaffsFred
Reviews.Content: We have just had a break at the Ampere for our Golden Wedding Anniversary. The Hotel was superb, the staff, so helpful and friendly. The rooms were of a good size and very clean, ( linen changed daily). The food was excellent and the location could not have been better, it was quiet but in easy reach of all the sites. The only down side was the lack of tea-making facilities and the fact that the bar was closed for refurbishment, but that is unimportant. I would love to go back there. Thanks to the staff for a great time

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Decent”
Reviews.Author: The-Rapture
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about ten minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe at the top end of the Champ Elysees. Hotel staff were welcoming, helpful and friendly. Exterior was pretty standard but interior is nice, contemporary, with a computer in reception where you can check your emails for free. The rooms are pretty standard but the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms impeccable with the amenities you would expect including LCD televisions and bathrobes. The Ampere is pretty much everything you would expect from a four star hotel that actually deserves its four star rating i.e. no complaints or flaws but not quite the extravagence to gain that extra star. The real highlight for us however, was the breakfast. The patio gardens are charming and the selection for breakfast was wide, varied and extremely moderately priced when coupled with the room rates. I can't comment on the full menu as we always tend to eat out when we go away, but if the breakfast was anything to go by then I can't imagine there being any complaints. The hotel is also conveniently located next to a metro station and a short taxi ride from the Gard De Nord station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Just What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: joshwilson10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on 21/03/2009 having booked through alpharooms for £105 Double Room inc breakfast. The main reason I booked it was due to the rest of the good reviews on here and it certainly lived up to our expectations. The hotel was very clean and presentable. The rooms were of a good size for the purpose and the minibar had a great choice. The staff were helpful and even let me use the reception computer to check in online for my return flight. Breakfast was good - cereal, hot breakfast, bread, cheese ham etc etc! The restaurant just down the road is very good and for a reasonable price. The nearest tube station is Pereire which is only about 100m away. From there you can get a direct RER to the Eifell Tower or into town.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rchbremner
Reviews.Content: I have been in the travel business for nearly 20 years and have never reviewed a hotel before and felt that I should after visiting this gem of a hotel. This was my first time in Paris and the hotel was very easy to find as per the hotels websites directions.First impressions mean a lot and we were greeted by very friendly reception staff and the porter.. The rooms were very clean and a decent size, comfortable bed. We only stayed for 1 night but were thwere for the full 2 days and we really could not get to grips whether it was in a good location or not though the metro is only 2 mins down the road and you can get anywhere in Paris for €1.60. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable base, close to the metro(bear in mind Paris is a huge city and everything is spread out!)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: vivadixie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few nights at Hotel Ampere. What a find!! Our room, on the sixth, floor was comfortable and spacious (by Parisian standards). The bathroom was large with walk-in shower and separate bath, bathrobes and slippers and lots of towels. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was better than any we've experienced on our many trips to the city. The restaurant and bar areas were comfortable. The only downside is the traffic noise but this seems to be unavoidable in Paris and is not even worth mentioning, just take some earplugs. Will definately return to Hotel Ampere (and the Lebanese restaurant opposite)

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints! Really Enjoyed Our Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Fiona044
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and had a brill time. Really loved the hotel and have no complaints what so ever! Myself and my boyfriend enjoyed our stay immensley. The Hotel is in a nice quiet location but is close to the Arc de Triomphe we use to walk to it every morning. There are a selection of restuarants of cafes near the hotel so you have a good choice. The hotel was really modern, cosy and the rooms were equipped with everything you could need. The rooms was small but that is standard in Paris i hear but it was really cosy and warm. We had breakfast included in our stay which was really lovely and had a great selection for everyone. The staff were lovely and very helpful from the time we arrived. We were greeted at the reception and our bags were whisked away to our room while the receptionist gave us our key and signed a few papers etc. it was a nice touch after a long day. We had no complaints and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone we know. We hope to return again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: met0813
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of our trip to Paris at the Hotel Ampere. We selected the hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and were pleased that it met our expectations. We arrived earlier than the posted check-in time and were happily given a room with a garden view on the 3rd floor. Being Paris, the room was small, but we found the bed to be comfortable and large. The carpet and quilt, while appearing clean, could probably be updated. We were only there for one night, so the size wasn't an inconvenience; however, if we would have stayed at the hotel for our entire week, it could have been a bit uncomfortable. The location was great. The hotel is just a few steps from the Place Pereire metro station, which quickly takes you to several stops with multiple lines to get anywhere in the city. It's also a nice walkable trip from the Arc de Triomphe (about 15 minutes). Our room rate (which we found on a discount hotel website for about 100 euros less than the rack rate) included a hot/cold buffet breakfast of scrambled eggs, toast, bacon, sausage, pastries, cereal, cheeses and fruit. The desk staff were very helpful and seemed happy to make dinner reservations on our behalf at a restaurant we chose. We easily found a taxi in the morning to take us to CDG for our trip back to the States. If we hadn't found one on the street, we would have easily walked to the Place Pereire taxi stand. I'd definitely recommend this hotel if paying the rate we did, but not if it is closer to the posted rate or doesn't come with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “More 3* than 4*”
Reviews.Author: localUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, close to the metro but within walking distance of the Champs Elysees - there are restaurants close by, but avoid the Rafael which has possibly the rudest waitress in Paris - quite an achievement! The hotel has its own restaurant too which looked nice although we didn't eat there. It has a lovely little garden which would be nice to have a drink in during the summer, at night they lit tea candles all around it which was lovely. The rooms are very three star with dingy dark wood furnishings, and sheets and blankets instead of duvets - I am sure they were clean but the blankets looked quite old. The rooms were clean but quite noisy as a lot of the flooring is wooden and so you can hear people stomping around. Breakfast was really poor, it was a Sunday and people had to queue outside for over 45 minutes, those of us who came last found that there were no croissants, juice or yoghurt. Very badly organised. Not a bad hotel for Paris but I am sure you could get a better three star for less money than this 4*.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel nice area”
Reviews.Author: guzzle-guts
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in a good area of Paris half hour walk to Arc de triumph good brekkie clean room never had dinner but the restraunt next door head towards the roundabout is perfecto nice bar cocktails and a friendly quaint little courtyard to enjoy brekkie or drinks highly reccommend

Reviews.Title: “Ampere Hotel -- FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: CRHenson
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I had the pleasure of staying at your wonderful hotel for eight nights. We were so impressed with the ambiance, accommodations and exemplary service that we received while staying there. The hot buffet breakfast each morning was fantastic, with an incredible assortment of very tasteful food. Without a doubt the next time that we return to Paris we will have our travel agent book our reservation with your hotel. Your establishment was, as Americans would say, was the “frosting on the cake” in terms of our visit to Paris. We both wish you and your staff a very Happy New Year and thanks again for helping make our recent stay in Paris extra special. Charlie and Breita, San Diego, CA

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Honeymoon !!!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_married_man
Reviews.Content: We have been to Ampere hotel for our honeymoon and it was a great experience !!! When we arrived we told reception that it was our honeymoon and they upgrade us to a deluxe room without cost .We surprised when we get in the room because they were welcome us via tv with our names ...Dimitris-Rita !!! We were at the 4th floor ,room 42V and we liked it very much because it was huge ,with a great bathroom , fabulous bed ,great view as you wake up in the morning and look outside ... The only negative was that it was twin-beds room .We asked for double room but they answer us that all the rooms are twin beds ,very surprised of it because it 's a great hotel . We liked walking around the hotel and the square ,it's a great place to stay and you can easily go out for drink or eat around the square Pereire . French cuisine ,especially meat is totatlly bad for greek people like us ... Anyway... we have the best memories from Paris and we will never forget them !!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Time”
Reviews.Author: PCLWeymouthDorset
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great value for Paris. We booked a triple room for my wife and 4 year old daughter. No problems with space or facilities. Bathroom spotless with good quailty towels, bathrobes and toiletries. The breakfast room was al ittle small but tables laid in the garden and bar area added space. The breakfast was enough to set you up for the day. Staff were more than helpful and always went out of their way to assist you no matter what time of day. We arrived gone midnight to check in!! The hotel is a 15 minute stroll to the 'Arc', and then onto the main attractions of Paris. We walked everywhere only using the Metro to return at night, more to see on foot . We would stay at this hotel again without hesitation. Direction from CDG, train to Gare du Nord, Metro line 4 (towards Porte d'Orleans), change at Reaumur Sebastopol, then Metro line 3 (towards Pont de Levallois Becon), get off at Pereire, hotel 200m fron station. Enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty room shouldnt be rate 4 star”
Reviews.Author: RatcliffeManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed 15/17th August, my husband booked it as a birthday treat for my 40th. And booked 4 star with it being a special occasion. So he paid more wanting it to be special. The hotel entrance etc is nice enough. But our room which was number V60, was not nice enough. It was tatty the curtain was hanging off the end of the rail. The walls were dirty & paper peeling off in the corner near the TV area. All the surfaces were scuffed. The bathroom was okay apart from the shower tray which was mouldy where the seal was coming off, Yak. The room was not a 4 star we should have stayed in a 2 star at least you get what you pay for we paid a lot higher price to stay here and it was not good at all. Breakfast was nice served in the room. The staff were nice, apart from the German night manager. Who was rude and even asked us if we were guests at the hotel. We told him we were no happy with the standard of the room, but he didnt really care. Also in the shower was an lid off a bottle of shampoo. We hadnt used it at that stage it had been left there by the person before, therefore the shower was not cleaned properly. Wont be staying again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: visitorDxb
Reviews.Content: We were there for 5 days. Unfortunatly the 3 pm check in time was a problem as our flight landed early in the morning. We just left our luggage with the concierge and walked down to Arc de Triomphe - 20 to 25 mins by walk. Room is small by all standards but nice and housekeeping quite efficient. Breakfast is also quite adequate and managed very well. Most of the staff speak English and are quite helpful. The Metro is just a stone's throw away(Periere) and you can go just about anywhere in Paris by the Metro as there is a station close to every attraction. Once you decide where you want to go, the staff will help you out on which line to take . Once you get the hang of it, the Metro is quite easy to use and is the most cheapest and efficient way of getting around. Just across the street off the Metro station, is a huge store Monoprix where u can buy all the stuff u want esp water which can be quite expensive in the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: klafrow1
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at the Ampere for business. For personal vacation purposes, I thought the price would be prohibitive. I found a great rate on Hotelclub.com of 150 E for a double room and 132 E for a single room. (Including breakfast.) I was traveling with my elderly parents and the comfort of the hotel, convenience and helpful staff was perfect. Breakfast was ample, even by American standards. I highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: JRLCW
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week-long stay at Hotel Ampere with my 11 year old daughter -- we had a wonderful time! As others have mentioned, the hotel is very conveniently located to both the RER (C) and the metro (3), so getting around is a breeze. Our room was on the 2nd floor, facing the garden courtyard and was very quiet in the evening. The neighborhood is residential, but with plenty of cafes and restaurants closeby; the Arc de Triomphe is about a 15 minute walk away. As a woman traveling alone with my daughter, I felt very safe in the area, even when returning late at night via RER or metro. The Monoprix and local patisserie are just around the corner, both of which came in quite handy. The room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We paid 160 euro/night which included the buffet breakfast (pastries, fruit, cereal, eggs, sausage, cheese, coffee, tea, hot chocolate).
