If there's one thing to quibble about, it would be the relatively small size of the room (two twin beds pushed together, not much room for anything else), but we didn't spend too much time in the room anyway! Too much else to see and do! We hope to return to Hotel Ampere soon !

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and convenient for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: jledwards
Reviews.Content: Contemporary hotel with helpful, English speaking staff. Conveniently placed within throwing distance of the Metro and Champs Elysee easily accessible on foot. Drinks & food very expensive (but then everywhere in Paris is!) We ordered room service and had a very ordinary burger and fries for two, 2 beers and a cheese plate which consisted of two small pieces of cheese and a couple of crackers - they charged us £50 for the priviledge!!!!! I might add we did not repeat the experience. Room very clean and well maintained - tea/coffee facilities would have been nice - only option was to purchase tea/coffee at £5 a cup. Take your own travel kettle! Only thing that was unpleasant was the awful smell of drains in the reception/bar area which was unsucessfully masked by an overpowering air freshener that made me gag as much as the smell they were trying to cover up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Bucajack
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ampere with my girlfriend in March. The hotel is situated in a very nice part of the city and is only 10-15 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. If you dont want to walk there is a Metro stop a minute away. The stop is called Pereire. The Hotel is on Ave. De Villiers but dont use the Villiers Metro stop because its 20 minutes away (we learned this the hard way!!!) The hotel staff are great. They helped us reserve a table at a great restaurant called 6 New York (great views of the Eiffel Tower from your table) and gave us loads of great advice about the city. We stayed in a standard double room (beware this is two single beds put together!) which was basic but very comfortable with everything you need. The hotel bar is nice but expensive (like all bars in Paris). The average price for a bottle of Heineken was €6-7. The hotel was great value and I would definitely recommend it to anyone planning a short stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Zivana
Reviews.Content: A friend offered us a voucher for 1 night in Paris and we decided to try the Ampère (15-16 Feb 2008). We chose this hotel because it had an in-house parking. The parking is not too difficult to use, it is small but we had a Jeep and were able to park there. The girls at the reception are really friendly and very helpful. The room on 2nd floor, patio view was nice. Not really big, but just enough for the 2 of us. The bathroom was really huge. For breakfast you had a large buffet, with all you could ask for. The metro is close and you need about 10 minutes to reach the “Galeries Lafayette”. The neighbourhood is nice and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely correct Price/performance ratio”
Reviews.Author: spiros100
Reviews.Content: We went there for just a night but the Price/performance ratio was absolutely correct (140 Euros/night) . The front desk and bar staff were very helpful and ready to anshwer all questions. The rooms were clean and modern with WiFi Intenet and a great view on the lovely Garden when located inside but a little bit tiny. 4th Floor rooms are smokings rooms so be aware. Included breakfast selection was O.K. but not superb. Location pretty good for the RER and Metro line. A trip to the center will take about 15 min with the Metro Line. Overall we would say the hotel was very good and would definitely stay there again if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Georgie173
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay this year at the Ampere. Although still good I think we may have hit a low point. In April 2007 they had been very helpful, (I gave them 5’s all round for ratings). I knew what I wanted accommodation wise this time and knew I was arriving late so contacted them first by telephone to check I could upgrade to a junior suite with a small balcony and then backed it up with an email. Once we arrived we found that they hadn’t done what I requested and argued with me that no junior suites had balconies. Eventually once at our room they agreed that rooms on the higher floors had balconies but couldn’t accommodate us with one until the following day. We moved on day two. We ordered room service the first night which was very good and quick. The second night we ate at the Bistro 17e next door to the hotel. Again it was up to its usual standard. On the third night we walked down Rue Ampere towards Rue Wagram where we found the most exquisite small bistro called L’Ampere. It was full of French locals and the food was exciting and of a superb quality, served at a leisurely pace. Highly recommend. We took the rouge open top bus trip around Paris. Very good but extremely cold as November so recommend wrapping up warm in the winter for this. We stopped off at quite a few places on route to explore and picked the bus up again later. Visit Musée d’Orsay as it’s full of wondrous paintings and sculptures, (allow about 5 hours). Try and get to Place de la Concorde at dusk as the photographic opportunities are wonderful. Café Le Petit Pont, opposite Notre Dame is also a good place to eat. At lunchtime it is full of business people, locals and tourists eating. Late at night it comes alive with a pianist and people enjoying an evening out watching the world go by. We plan to go back to Paris again in June 08 and will probably stay here again. The hotel is in such a lovely neighbourhood and has such good connections to central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 40's”
Reviews.Author: Marcohunt
Reviews.Content: We decided to go back to Paris for my 40th birthday and once again decided to stay at the Ampere. This was our third trip here and we love it. We have since recommended it to close friends, who have heard so much about it. The hotel is excellent in every way, the rooms, the service, the food, the staff. Located in th 17th district this hotel offers everything you ever wanted from a high quality hotel in Paris, but don't tell everyone, keep this as your little secret!! I can recommend the restaurant close to the hotel, which for 34 euros offers a three course meal with wine, fantastic. Of the other amenities, there is a Monoprix just round the corner, and numerous cafes close by. Just one tip avoid the Buffalo grill, unless you want to wait for ages for your food and then be dissapointed when it does arrive. 20/10 this hotel is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I usually book my Hotels online but in this case I was booked on a package for the Rugby World Cup by my travel agent. The Hotel is located in a lovely area of Paris, maybe a bit too far from the centre of things but the Metro is less than a 2 minute walk away. As far as the Hotel is concerned I would rate it no more than a good 3 star. Our room was quiet small even by Paris standards, on our first night we had no hot water in our room, had to shower in freezing cold water. Also the sink stopper was blocked with water and was unable to release it. I called reception and they promised to fix the problems immediately but it was the following day before somebody came to our room and got the hot water working. As stated previously the room was quiet small but spotlessly clean . Overall I was somewhat disappointed with this Hotel after reading previous reviews I was expecting a little more, would not go there again .

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: EnglandClick
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was situated in a good location in Paris which had good communication of transport. The Hotel itself was clean and tidy but the staff are not so helpful and polite which is a downside of course, as society is more aware. We all have barrier problems in speaking in different languages in many countries but regardless to the contary many of us know more than one which my family speaks fluent in 2 languages. In this case was more difficult for us as there refused to help in neither the languages we are fluent in. The breakfast in the morning is not what one would really pay for if there was a choose just have room only. Paris has many patisseires and boulangeries which are located around the hotel on Avenue neil or Mcmahon. Within the hotel there is no one who really takes charge to rectify problems when they occur whic they have the attitude of not caring. When booking through a Travel agent if you wish to choose the hotel, actually ask how big is the triple room, the room which was given to us was unsuitable for the 3 adults in one room. When we arrived at the hotel on the morning we had to wait till late afternoon to see the room until then we did not see what the room looked like. One double bed and one bed on the floor which did not have a partion or anything. The room was small and 3 people crammed in one room. When we did complain they tried to find us another room but very reluntant to go out of there way and explain any details to us. In the end it costs us more than the whole trip but together as we ended up in separate rooms which we never asked for to begin with. Regardless of the whole senario we were charged full price on top of what we already paid for through the Travel Agent. So the whole trip of Paris was very expensive and unpleasent stay at the hotel. The only thing I recommend from this Hotel is the Bistro which was located beside the hotel it had excellent food and excellent Service better than the Hotel service put together.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: roomfinder
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel about 10yards from a metro stop in very nice locality in Paris. The staff were very welcoming, friendly to kids and offered several personal touches. They let me use the hotel computer to check my email. There was always fruit in front of the lobby. The room was very clean and a good size with separate low lying bed for the children. Our room was on the 7th floor and we could see the Eifel Tower from there, really beautiful view when lit up at night. The bathroom was very spacious and clean with plenty of luxury bath products. Lots of choice for breakfast and also the option to have breakfast in the garden which we did on a lovely sunny day.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: njabbott
Reviews.Content: May wife and I stayed three nights in August 2007, after choosing the hotel based on comments from other Trip Advisor users. The hotel is stylish, yet unpretentious and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The first morning I followed the advice of some users and opted for the room service breakfast. This was rather poor, so the next 2 mornings we went to thew buffet which was excellent quality, with food, plates etc replenished promptly. The room was very nice, although they will need some minor cosmetic work soon or they will quickly start looking tatty. We liked the very slightly off the beaten path location, finding it convenient but not too touristy. Also loved the bistro next door great food, service and value. The ac was not working (or maybe turned off), but as Paris was cold and damp during our stay :-( we did not report it to the hotel. A very minor issue was the difficulty we had getting a taxi at the end of our stay . However, this was hardly the hotel's fault (in fact the receptionist worked tirelessly to find us a cab and we did make the station in time to catch our Eurostar. If we were to visit Paris again would definitely stay at the Ampere again.

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable four days”
Reviews.Author: sbaig
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ampere with our two daughters 10 and 15. We had two interconnecting double rooms on the fourth floor overlooking the inner garden. Honestly, there is nothing bad I can think about this hotel. It is perfect in every respect. The location was ideal, a little away from the maddening crowd but conveniently placed right next to the Periere metro stop and Periere Levallois stop on the C train. Getting to the hotel from Eurostar station (Gare du Nord) was a little difficult with bags due to the metro connections but manageable nonetheless. On our way back we took the taxi, hardly €15. Check in was a breeze. I had booked the rooms through octopustravel.com at a very reasonable rate for four nights. The reception desk had everything ready when we reached there at around 4pm. Rooms were of decent size according to European standards and all the closets were nicely tucked away in corners, a smart use of space. Bathrooms were clean, no L’occitane products in our room but the ones we had were of good quality too. Rooms and bathrooms were cleaned every single day. Breakfast is included in their room rate. The first day we had it delivered to our room, it came with coffee/tea, orange juice and a good selection of pastries, but no hot items. The rest of the days we ate in their restaurant, the fare was decent, pastries, scrambled eggs, cheese, fruits etc. It did get very crowded one day as it was raining and there was less seating inside the restaurant but the staff still managed to make everyone sit and replenish the food items quickly. Never ate dinner at the hotel as there is plenty of good quality and reasonably priced places around. We ate at the Lebanese place Phoenicia across the street one day then at New Sana (Indian) and Lotus de Thai on other days. Everywhere we ate the food and service was of good quality. There is a Monoprix supermarket a few streets from Av de Villiers for getting water and snacks. Hotel staff is very nice and friendly. They all speak English and are ready to help. Internet is not free; if you bring a laptop then you can buy hours and use them as you go along. We bought 10 hours for €30 and used them over four days. We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel. It made our stay in Paris so much more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Loubox
Reviews.Content: Overall a good stay, very impressive when we first entered. The lobby and staff at the front desk were wonderful. Its what you would expect from a 4star hotel. The room was nice, we booked a treble room but their idea of a treble room was a double bed and what looked like a box on the floor with a mattress in it. The room was comfy though. The bathroom was fantastic, no complaints there. Our problem was with the staff. We had a fight over staff with breakfast, they were rude and ignorant and as we didnt have good French that made it hard, they were very reluctant to help you undertsand what they were trying to convey, we got the impression that it was very inconvienent of us to not speak French! We had prepaid for our breakfast and it was delivered to our room, however on one particular morning the phone wasnt working and we had to go down to request it (we figured this out ourselves!) The member of staff brought up the breakfast (which was sizeably smaller than the previous days breakfast) and only brought 2 and not the requested 3. When I pointed this out he said he would come right back with a third, he came back with a cup and a yoghurt and handed them to me and told me tough luck this was all I was getting! Also the restaurant was closed and there was no room service, not something I expected for the money I paid for the rooms. The bar was also ridiculously expensive, we expected it to be dear alright but this was just insane. The hotel itself was gorgeous (just dont ask for a triple rom!) but I was sorely let down on the services the hotel provided. If I was to go back to Paris I would definatly book elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “loved the ampere hotel”
Reviews.Author: teres
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. It is a lovely hotel, spotless and has a very helpful staff. The breakfast is excellent ranging from coffee and juice, cereals, breads, fruit and a cooked breakfast, there was also a selection of cheese and hams. We decided to have our evening meals at the bistro beside the hotel, as recommended by previous tripadvisor guests. We were not disappointed, they have an english version of the menu and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a great 3 star. The front desk and bar staff were very helpful, the rooms were clean and modern and the location pretty good for the RER and Metro. Didn't encounter the breakfast scrum but we ate by 8.30am and it seemed most of the rush started just after that Also didnt eat at the Bistro next door. Being the only non veg in a group of 6 limited my choices but we did eat at the lebanese resturant across the road which was quite good. The only grumble is that I wish they had given us all 3 rooms on the same floor but this wasnt too much of an issue. Enjoyed nicking the L'Occitane products :-) Would go back here.

Reviews.Title: “We would happily stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPacific
Reviews.Content: I can see why this hotel maintains its high position in the rankings. I stayed here with my wife and 11 year old daughter for 4 days in a superior triple room on the 4th floor overlooking the road. Overall I would say it is pretty good at just about everything, but not excellent at anything, nor poor at anything. In a city full of hotels that have at least some drawbacks that makes The Ampere stand out. The location is good because it is next to the Metro and RER for easy access to everywhere. Also, I did feel safe at night walking around the neighbourhood, which is relatively quiet. Many reporters have commented on the Bistro next door, which is very good - make sure you book your table the day before. The room was just about large enough, the beds were comfortable (and I'm not a great sleeper in hotels generally) and everthing was clean. The bathroom was re-stocked with Loccitane products daily, although the bath was tiny. The shower was the preferred option, and the toilet was in its own room. The window had a motorised blackout shutter, which was extremely effective at eliminating all noise and light. You will need to use an alarm to wake you up because it could be 11am and it will still appear to be completely dark. All the hotel excpet one floor of bedrooms is non-smoking. The breakfast room is typically busy, with overspill into the courtyard (if dry) and the bar area. Once again, the breakfast is good but not great - a self service buffet of decent variety. The buffet quickly runs out of everything and the replenishment is not always that fast, so if you see something you fancy it's a case of grabbing it there and then or maybe waiting a while. The service at the front desk is very good - if you ask for help I cannot imagine that you would be left wanting. Nothing is too much trouble and their English is excellent. We didn't use the bar in the evnings, so can't comment on that. It's easy travelling from CDG and Orly airports - head for the RER Pereire Levallois (on the C1 line towards Pontoise) and the hotel is just around the corner. From CDG take the RER to St Michel Notre Dame, then take the C1 RER towards Pontoise. It's as simple as that and you even get a view of the Eiffel Tower along the way. Access to the main sightseeing spots in Paris is also good, being on the direct RER line to the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame, etc. Enjoy your stay here - we did and we'll be happy to come back.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandaikia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading comments from previous guests and found most of the comments are true - this is a lovely hotel. The staff, particularly in the front office - Ms. Marie, is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is also fabulous. The location is also excellent. Pereire-levalois Metro station is within one minute walk. You can easily reach Eiffel by "C line" and shopping center and other interesting places by "3 line" . We booked a family room for 3 adults and one baby. The room is big enough and the facility is okay. Free internet connection, minibar etc. Only "coffee/tea maker" is missed. However, the cleaning service should be improved. During our 3 nights stay, our room was only cleaned one time:-)

Reviews.Title: “Ampere is electrifying”
Reviews.Author: burryholme
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend in June. Close to Periere Metro Station and Monoprix Supermarket near-by. Reception bright and modern, attentive and pleasant staff, fresh fruit available in bowls at the lift. Room was of a decent size, comfy beds, LCD TV, superb bathroom with complimentary L'occitaine products. Breakfast was lovely, nice mix of cooked items, cold meats, chesse, breads and fresh fruit - had to queue once for 5 minutes on Saturday at 9.00am, but staff kept guests moving and all were offered the option of eating in the adjacent piano bar. Unlike some reviewers, we didn't have such a nice meal at Bistro 17 at the end of the same side of the street. We were encouraged by the all-in price, but disappointed with the food and the slow service (start to finish took just over 3 hours - which is long for children who are passed their bedtime) but that doesn't reflect on the hotel which overall I would say is a splendid choice for this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Okay For Paris”
Reviews.Author: conswart
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel in June. The first night our room had no air conditioning as it was broken. Room was on the small side, The next day they said the air conditioning was fixed however it was not . Moved to a different room which was slightly bigger. The breakfast was of a good standard. Hot and cold buffet . Not to many croissants on show though. Good touch with international newspapers which are free. Excellent location with a metro down the street and RER around the corner. Good Italian restaurant at the top of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcs-Y
Reviews.Content: This is the best value for a four star boutique hotel in paris.the metro and train RER line is just 5minutes away.Monoprix(grocery) is also 7minutes away.Paris metro is very efficient and reliable hence,metro stop like opera are on the same line as the hotel(metro:Periere) where you can switch line to most of other places and galeries lafayette also only few stops away on the same line. The hotel uses L'occitane in their bathroom,my wife love it.The ambience,the people ,the convenience are hard to beat. If i must say,the only drawbacks i find is they dont have coffee and tea making facility in the room,hence no boiler as well.(However if you ask for it, they can get you pot of hotwater from the bar even around midnight before the bar closes) The breakfast is excellent but sometimes you need to queue as the breakfast room is not big enough to accommodate everyone at one times.The great breakfast is worth waiting for. Also if you stay on the 4th floor and lift went out of order during a long weekend, too bad you have to climb up stairs before the next working day . Still, if i ever come back to paris, this is the hotel i will come back to.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fab!”
Reviews.Author: MuppetLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotless and the staff are lovely, totally accomodating. The location is perfect - away from the hustle and bustle but within walking distance of Arc de Triomph and just over the road from the Metro. Breakfast great too - very good pamplemousse juice! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: juina
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four day trip to Paris. I, my husband and our 13 year old daughter thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Ampere. The location was great - near metro and RER stations, good restaurants and cafes in the immediate surroundings. The hotel itself is modern, beautifully decorated, and very clean. The staff were really helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast although the restaurant was a bit crowded in the morning. So room service might be a good choice. The triple room was rather small, but had quite a spacious bathroom (L'Occitane toiletries, bathrobes) and a separate toilet. I can warmly recommend this hotel to anybody planning a trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: mooreclan
Reviews.Content: Paris. Ampere Hotel. March 2007 After countless and endless hours on the net finally choose the Ampere. Its not in the center but with the Metro less than a minute walk away its not far from anywhere. Booked hotel via Thomas Cook and flights through BMI Baby. Rooms were comfortable and clean. We were only in Paris for the weekend so really didnt spend a great deal in the hotel. A must for Paris is The Moulin Rouge great show but those on our table had dinner there and would not recommend it (we only went for the show). Would also advise a trip on a river cruise a night. The meal we had on the cruise was fantastic, paid 20EUROS to upgrade, this gave us a window seat and a better choice of wines. We had a great romantic weekend

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: LMCardiff
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic, I did a lot of research as I was booking three rooms on bahalf of my whole family and wanted to make sure I chose somewhere that everyone would like. the location is great, so close to the tube, but also a lovely walk up to the Arc du Triumph. Everyone loved it, it's in a really nice area, not dodgy and lots of bars and restaurants near-by. We stayed for two nights over a weekend, and it really was everything we could have hoped for. A great breakfast too. Would definitley stay there again, and not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SteveNorthampton.UK
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely quiet , modern hotel situated about fiteen minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. The excellent Paris Metro is within 100 metres meaning you can be virtually anywhere in no time at all. The hotel is small, with about two dozen rooms. It is also immaculately clean with all that you would expect of a good standard hotel. The staff without exception were all very good. I would certainly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice base from which to explore a fantastic city. If I get back to Paris, I know where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: bc67
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our weekend stay in this very nice hotel. Good size room for Paris, very comfortable king size beds, excellent room service breakfast (highly recommend) and right beside the Metro (Perriere). Good location with plenty of restaurants nearby. Staff were very attentive. Only complaint about this hotel would be the prices on the mini bar, but that is not exactly unusual!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessieIreland
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel we found the staff to be very friendly and helpfull. On arrival we were asked would we like to upgrade to a room (26A)over looking the garden which we did at an extra nightly supplement, the only complaint I would have there was a bath with a shower hose but this was fixed to the lower part of the wall so if you wanted to shower it meant holding the the shower head over you while trying to wash yourself which had water spraying all over the place. It was easier to have a bath and use the shower head to do your hair while sitting, I dont know if other rooms had proper showers or if this is the case in every room. Otherwise the hotel was spotless breakfast was served upto 10am in the dining room or 11 in your bedroom and the staff were more than helpfull. Periere was the nearest Metro station and we had no problem getting around. As other reviews have stated it is quite expensive to have soft drinks or water in the hotel but the supermarket is on the next street and just a couple of minutes walk you can buy a 6 pack of coke for 2.25 euro and a small bottle of water for 35cent. A lot of resturants do good deals on a 3 course set menu with a bottle of wine or try the Latin quarter we had a lovely 3 course meal for 15 euro each and ask for the house wine your in France and its good. Just one other word of warning we used Paris shuttle (not the airport shuttle service) to collet us from the airport as this was a cheaper way to travel from Beauvis airport directly to our hotel by shaing a cab but we were brought to Euro Disney first this added another 96klm to an already 78klm journey then on our return journey to the Airport the driver was an hour late collecting us and we thought we would miss our flight and check in time. In hindsight I think it would have been better using the airport shuttle service and getting a taxi from the teminal to the hotel. This is my third vacation using the reviews from trip advisor its great to get tips and reviews of where your travelling to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Leathermashie
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Hotel Ampere last weekend. On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by a very helpful receptionist who, as it was our first visit to Paris, went out of his way to suggest the best places to visit, eat and drink. He also took some time out to show us a suite on the 8th floor and the spectacular views across the city to the Eiffel Tower. Our room was decent and comfortable standard. The Metro station is just round the corner from the hotel and very easy to use. If you get off at Opera, a great selection of shops are within easy strolling distance. If you get off at Sentier, it's a 15 minute walk to the Marais district for a good selection of bars and cafes. Earlier reviews have also mentioned breakfast. On our first morning, we arrived downstairs for breakfast just after 10am. Breakfast in the restaurant stopped at 10am (we thought it was 11am, so it was our own fault). However, you can order a continental breakfast to be delivered to your room at no extra cost. This can be done up to 11am. We popped back up to our room and phoned the kitchen - 10 minutes later a great breakfast arrived at our door. We did manage down to breakfast in plenty time the following morning. In our experience, the continental room service breakfast was far better than the haphazard breakfast served in the restaurant. All in all, this is a great hotel, in a great location, and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Pap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on a flying visit to Paris. Great reservations and reception staff. Very simple and swift check in. Nice room - slightly on the small side. We had a standard room with a king bed so the bed might have made the room seem slightly small. Only small niggle was a completely obnoxious bartender who obviously considers himself to be the centre of the universe. Hopefully, he'll move on to greater things in due course.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: pazboston
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Ampere last weekend, and it was lovely. The entryway of the hotel looks appropriately sleek and stylish. We were allowed to check-in a little early, which was great after a long overnight flight. The woman at the desk spoke good English, was friendly and gave excellent directions on how to take the metro to St. Germain, and later how to catch the RoissyBus to the airport. The bathroom was a good size (smaller than US hotels, but larger than some of the European bathrooms I've seen) and everything worked as it was supposed to, and was properly clean. The bed was comfortable, and there were extra pillows conveniently available in the closet. The location is a little out of the way if you are taking the metro everywhere because you will probably have to switch lines to go to most popular places. The metro stop is very close to the hotel, though, so if you're not into walking then that's a big plus. If you're a good walker, the arc de triomphe/champs elysees are a manageable walk away. Immediately around the hotel are plenty of places to eat, from simple cafes to fancy restaurants, an ATM, and I think I even saw a florist. The neighborhood is quiet, and felt very safe, even for two girls walking back from the metro late at night. Overall, I would definitely return to the Ampere for most purposes, though if I were going with a rowdy group I might try to stay somewhere nearer to nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickyDevon
Reviews.Content: Have just got home from 4 days in Paris with my husband and 13 year old daughter. We booked a superior triple room and we were not dissapointed at all. We had a large bathroom with shower, bath and seperate toilet and they were all extremely clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly (they speak good english). The breakfast was a buffet with a cooked breakfast or continental and was excellent. They have a lovely bar area with a piano playing during the evenings (not at weekends) where you can sit and relax after a tiring day sightseeing. The metro is a short walk away. You can walk to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs -Elysees if you want to but the metro is cheap and easy to use. There are some nice cafes and restaurants very near to the hotel. We will definately be going back to this hotel we just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love Hotel Ampere”
Reviews.Author: not-a-southerner
Reviews.Content: Wonderful european style hotel. One block from Metro and nice walk ( a couple of miles) to Arc de Triumph. We walked into the city a few times and enjoyed seeing the side streets and locals. Wonderful service. Charming small dining room with generous and delicious breakfast daily. Delightful patio area for dining out for lunch on a nice day. Small rooms but nice and plenty of room since we were rarely in our room. Separate toilet and bath rooms. Our view was overlooking side street. City-like and normal street noise but nothing unusual. Nice area to walk around and just look at how the locals live. I still think fondly of my stay at Hotel Ampere and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Paulieboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 16-18 September 2006 for our seventh wedding anniversary. We stayed in a Superior (roadside) Room - Hotel web site price -280euros, we paid 125euros with a hotel booking website. We didn't ask to be upgraded or moved to a room with a garden view as we only used the hotel to sleep in. On Sunday morning we had breakfast in a restaurant by the Rodin Museum, and on Monday morning we caught the 07:15 Eurostar train back to Waterloo. Arriving on the 16th around 22:00, we checked in. The front-of house staff were amenable and courteous. Before leaving London on the Saturday morning, we tried to book the Jules Verne restaurant (Eiffel Tower) for dinner on our anniversary on the Sunday night, but they told us they were fully booked. At check-in we asked one of the hotel staff if they would call the restaurant and try and get us a table (I wish I had taken his name now). No problem - what time!!!! Let that be a lesson - if the staff at the restaurant do not like your accent wait until you get to France and ask the concierge to try! The Superior Room was a good size. The WC and Bathroom were separate. The Bathroom comprised a separate bath and shower. We had an iron and ironing board and plenty of wardrobe space. There was a safe in the wardrobe. Although we had a roadside room we did not notice any traffic noise (maybe because we stayed at a weekend). From previous reviews, we walked down to the Place du Mal Juin (big roundabout with at least a dozen restaurants situated on it, and the nearest Metro station), which was only 100m. Again, from previous reviews, we asked for a table at Le Bistro Du 17eme. They were happy to take us at 22:50, even though the restaurant closed at 23:30. We had the fixed menu 33euros per person (three courses which included a bottle of wine). We left the restaurant just after midnight and never felt we were being rushed. The food was good. The restaurant was packed (possibly because it was a Saturday night?). Recommendation for the Jules Verne restaurant - * Michelin Star chef, Alain Reix Fantastic setting and amazing food. We had the 'Menu of Discovery', which comprised 7 courses and cost 128euros per person (everyone at the table has to have this menu - one person cannot have it and the other(s) order from the a la carte menu). It must be ordered before 21:30. Examples from the menu included - First course: 'Superposition of baby leeks, eels lightly smoked and duck liver, and green tomato chutney; one of the desserts: 'Pure caribbean chocolate jelly and avocado emulsion."

Reviews.Title: “6 wonderful days in paris”
Reviews.Author: tomatorah
Reviews.Content: Clean room and hotel (corridors smelt good!), staff friendly and helpful allowing us to use hotel phone when we had to make a phone call to england. Area is good with lots of restaurants around, but for those looking for a bar around Pereire (hard work) head out to St Germain Des Pres. Room average size but always clean and comfortable. Breakfast came as part of the lastminute deal and was the usual affair of croissants etc and was just fine for me to stock up before a days sightseeing. If you get the chance head out to St Germain and fidn the restaurant La Petula, for a good meal. Although there are lots of good restaurants around the area it is worth exploring. p.s find the patisserie opposite hotel mercedes-brilliant! :)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but even better restaraunt next door”
Reviews.Author: michaelgould
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a safe and pleasant area. Everything that has been written previously about this hotel seems to be spot on from our experience. Small but clean and comfortable room, very poor breakfast ......dont pay extra for it 10 min walk from the Arc De Triumphe and the Champs Elysees or 1 min walk to the Metro. The real Jewel of this area is the restaraunt almost next door to the hotel "17 em" 33 euros for a great meal with wine.and pre dinner Kir Royal......packed every night with locals.....very busy after 8-30 so to get a table at the weekend be there before 8........enjoy

Reviews.Title: “convenient but be early for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sigsvm
Reviews.Content: A nice comfortable hotel with a Metro & a RER station less than 100 meters away. You are in the heart of Paris but the quietness makes you wonder whether you are far away. The front office staff is very helpful, courteous and friendly. The rooms are neat and have good bathrooms. The only negative aspect was the poor breakfast service.The restaurant in charge and staff needed to be pushed if one wanted proper service. They never replenished cutlery nor food in time which meant one had to wait for things to happen a reason which the restaurant in charge stated was due to the kitchen being refurbished. A bit of courtesy like that of the front office would have helped largely. On ewould therefore advise guests to go for breakfast early rather than stroll in late for one may not get anything. Also be careful about using the mini fridge in the room.Suggest you go down to Monoprix market in the next lane and get your drinks ,chocolates etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Phil1957
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Ampere. We found it very pleasant and felt very at home there. The room was quite small but clean and well appointed. A nice feature is the small coutyard and garden area where you could have breakfast or an evening drink. We can highly recommend the restaurant a few yards from the hotel - Le Bistro du 17eme. Excellent 3 course meal with coffee and wine for 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 4 star”
Reviews.Author: J051
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews on Tripadvisor we booked this hotel. Not too sure why everyone is rating it! We stayed here for two nights at the end of July. It's in a nice quiet area of Paris and not far from the Metro station. The room was clean and tidy and so was the hotel. Breakfast was terrible and very disorganised. There were never any plates or glasses and not even any food in some cases! I would rate this hotel a 3 star. ps. don't take anything out of the minibar - its 6 euros just for a soft drink.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ampere over a weekend in July 2006. The rooms werent overly large, but the shower room was a good size and we had a lovely view over the garden. Breakfast had a reasonable choice included in our tariff, and we found the piano bar and garden to be a lovely spot to have a late night drink after hitting the sights of Paris. The area the hotel is in seemed to be an upmarket residential street, but you could walk to the Arc de Triomphe in about 15 minutes. Whilst the hotel isnt in the centre as such, the nearest Metro station is less than 100 yards away (Pereire) and you can quickly reach most areas by Metro. In addition, we flew with Ryanair to Beauvais and their bus terminates at Port Maillon is only about 15 minutes walk from the hotel One word of caution, the minibar in the room is automatic - soon as you remove the drink its charged to your account - and it costs 6 euros for a bottle of Kronenbourg. A tip would be to visit the "Monoprix" supermarket nearby - reception gave us directions, its only about 150 yards away, where you can buy 4 cans of Kronenbourg (bigger bottles with a higher alocohol content) for 2.60 euros and a bag of ice only costs 1.20 euros to cool them down. Another tip is that upon arrival we were told we would have a room overlooking the street, but for an additional 50 euros a night we could have one overlooking the garden, we declined the offer and got a garden room anyway. As for price we paid about £85 a night thru lastminute and found it to be excellent value - published tariff by the hotel is 210 euros a night. Overall I would thoroughly recommend the Ampere, just avoid the minibar!!
